The king’s guards walked up the cleared way through the streets. The large red muscled dragons were dressed in silver armor with only leg guards covering their feet. Although it may seem like they were simply walking, one guard had his hand out with his palm facing up. In the center of his palm layed a small box with a small opening and a thin layers of curtains covering the inside.

If one looked closely they would see a tiny head peeking out.

The human that sat inside the rather comfy box was named Colt, a fifteen year old who’s life has changed significantly over the last month. Months prior, there had been a Scuffle between neighboring kingdoms. The human villages had been given a short notice to evacuate. However Colt’s village had not received the message, and so a battle occurred outside the kingdom. Although The Dravol forces attempted to stay away from the villages, the fight was pushed to their location. Opposing forces marched through the Colt’s village, stomping on houses. Including The one with Colt’s parents inside. In the end the Dravol Kingdom won but at the cost of human lives. The messenger had been punished for not informing everyone and aid was given to the villages. Still, Colt was Orphaned and had no family left. However, while recovering dragon guards approached Colt with a message. The king Drogan has been filled with guilt in not ensuring everyone was safe and apologized to Colt. But also he offered to become family to him.

And so now Colt was being taken to the palace to become the second son of Drogon. He was very nervous as he had only seen paintings and heard reports of the king. Although he tried to suppress it, he couldn’t help but wonder if Drogan was sincere with his offer. He soon felt the movements of the guard holding him cease, he heard two clings against the outside of his box. Opening the curtains he was greeted by the face of a guard.” We’ve arrived at the palace, young prince”, the guard said smiling at the last part causing Colt to blush, not being used to such a title.” I would suggest you sit on Pol’s palm the rest of the way”. Nodding Colt climbed out of the box and on to Pol’s soft palm. The dragon holding him lifted the box and pocketed it before giving Colt a smile.

They entered the palace, passing portraits of past rulers before coming to a pair of doors that kept the king waiting. The guards glanced at Colt, and Pol curled his fingers a bit to reassure him before opening the doors. On a red carpet that stretched forward laid a throne with a large figure sitting upon it.

The purple dragon was slightly bigger then the guards and was dressed in silk gold pants and beneath his large feet were a pair of bejeweled sandals. He was shirtless which put his scaled eight pack as well as two large pecs on display. Looking at the throne seat, one could see his large buttocks pushing the cushion down. His large biceps had leather straps wrapped beneath his shoulders. A long red cape draped off his shoulders and to the side, and on his left index finger laid one gold ring.The guards approached the king, bowing their heads as soon as they were in front of him.

Colt’s gaze met that of Drogan’s, in the dragon’s eyes Colt saw wisdom, strength, and kindness. All his worries began to melt away as the king smiled and spoke.

“I see you’ve returned with my child”, Drogan’s voice was deep and soothing.

“Yes your majesty”, Pol replied as he brought the hand holding Colt closer to Drogan.

Drogan brought his hand forward and layed his fingers on top of Pol’s, creating a makeshift bridge. Colt glanced up at Pol, who smiled and nodded. Standing up, Colt made his way over, as the ground went from red to purple Colt wished he was barefoot, so he could feel the soft warmth. Arriving and stopping in the center of Drogan’s palm, he was brought up to the front of the king’s snout watching his orange eyes gain a sorrowful look.

“Colt, I’ve said this in my message and I wish to say it to you in person. I’m terribly sorry for what has happened to you. I entrusted a messenger to give word when I should have informed everyone myself! I ask not for forgiveness, but for a chance to care for you and to be your family now.”, Drogan finished placing a hand over his strong chest.

Colt began to process everything in his head. The king wanted him to be his child and care for him. He began to shed tears as he looked into Drog- his father’s eyes. “Yes! I’d love for you to be my dad!”

As soon as those words left Colt’s mouth, Drogan smiled and laughed bringing his new son to his right pectoral gently in a hug. The purple scales covering Drogan’s body were soft to the touch and Colt felt safe listening to the king’s mighty heartbeat. After the tender moment, Drogan placed his son on his large shoulder, purring as Colt nuzzled into his neck. Standing up, Colt caught a glimpse of his father’s large rear along with the deep imprint in the cushion but looked forward again as Drogan stepped down from his throne and faced his knights.

Your attire was fairly modest, a dark blue longcoat with holes for your wings, blue jeans, wrist band on your left wrist and red sash around your waist, and of course the necklace you wore as a lucky charm. Truth be told, your necklace doubled up as a way to carry a human should the desire ever come up.

It was a late night and you were up late working on a case. Humans had been disappearing all over the city. And not just in the dragon distract. Sure many of your kin didn't care but you did.

You rubbed your eyes tiredly as you read through all the known cases. Every report detailed a different human and where they were last seen. Past that there was usually not much to go off of.

You heard movement near your feet and looked down. A smile formed on your face as you saw your boyfriend trying to climb onto your foot. "Need a hand, Lukas?" You ask as you watched him struggle.

Lukas smirked. "No, no, I got this." He responds as he finally manages to pull himself onto your big toe. He sits there catching his breath for a bit.

You shake your head and leaning over, taking him in your claw and setting him on your chest. He looks at the case files sprawled out across the coffee table and looks at you. "More cases?" He asks, to which you nod. Lukas was worried every day, fearing he might be next. And you worried to. That was why you had to solve the disappearances. You felt Lukas snuggle into your chest. "What if I'm next?" He whimpers.

"Won't happen. I'll protect you." You said softly. You casually look down at him and smile. "Get some sleep Lukas, no need for you to be up all night with me." You say as you gently picked up your boyfriend.

He was clad in his light blue t shirt, and his shorts. Everything was blue. His eyes were like sapphires and even his hair was dark blue. He yawns as you tuck him into his sleeping spot for the night.

You chuckle, gently rocking your snoozing boyfriend to sleep within your bellybutton. With a sip from your coffee you go back to reading the reports and case files. There was no pattern that you could see.

None of the humans had anything in common. And none were in the same places when they vanished. You shook your head and decided to get some rest before your shift in six hours. It was going to be a boring patrol day but it meant you could think about the missing persons cases.

You often preferred to do your patrols on foot, allowed you to see more and notice details that you would've missed any other way. Lukas had joined you, both of you knowing no one would notice he was there. He sat in the "charm" hanging from your necklace and looked about, enjoying your time together. You knew the real reason was he didn't want to be alone.

During your patrol, you found yourself stopping at a diner where one of the missing humans had disappeared. Lukas winced at the thought of going inside but you assured him it'd be fine. As you entered, you grabbed a menu and gave it a look over. You weren't actually hungry but were more wondering if by chance human was on the menu.

"They wouldn't just announce it. It'd be one of those Special menus." Lukas says, knowing where your mind was.

You nodded and set the menu down but still took a seat at the counter. A waitress, pink dragon, stayed up to you and smiled. "Hello good looking, what can we get for your today?" She asks with a wink.

"Plain coffee, please." You respond as you pick up the newspaper from the counter. She skates off and soon returns with the coffee.

You had a hunch something wasn't right as you took subtle glances about the diner. It wasn't crowded. And the food smelled horrible but the few patrons present seemed like they couldn't get enough of the meals.

The waitress skates up to again. "Anything else for ya today, Sugar?" She asks.

You smirk. You had an idea but it might be frighten Lukas a little. He'd forgive you, you reasoned before turning to the pink dragoness. "Now somewhere where a guy might be able to..." you pause and whisper the last bit to her. "get a freshly caught human cooked up?"

Lukas begins struggling hard in the little cage. Either he's picked up on your plan and is playing along, or he's fearing for his life. The waitress gives you a dark smirk as she leans in close. "I'm sure Cooky could make just the thing." She says with a wink before skating off.

You quickly send a text to your partner on the force who was only a block away. Requesting his presence immediately to the diner.

The waitress soon returns as hands you a small slip of paper. It had a handful of dishes that were prepared with human as the main ingredient. You took your time eyeing the menu, trying to stall for your partner to arrive. Just as you were about to be forced into a choice, you hear the dragon you were waiting for enter.

Within moments, he's made his arrests and turns his attention to you. "Just patrolling, eh Morgan?" He asks. His scales are dark green and his uniform is a standard issued police uniform. He laughs slightly before pointing at your necklace. "Think you might need to tell Lukas something." He laughs before heading out.

You glance down and your eyes widen at the sight. Lukas had blanked out from fear and worry. "Lukas!" You call down before sliding the little guy into your hand. He seems to be coming around from your voice. With a sigh of relief you explain that it was just a ruse. He yells at you for a bit and you just stand there and take it.

After awhile, you head over to the agency you worked for and checked in with your higher ups. Stowed away in the kitchen were a handful of the missing humans. But several more were still missing.

13.content:
Across the universe existed a massive empire, lead by creatures once thought to be fables.

The Draken Empire, a large intergalactic kingdom led by titanic dragon like beings. Multiple galaxy and hundreds of planets fall under the kingdom's rule. The emperor is a cunning dragon, who's pride is matched by his intelligence. He knows how to bargain with a planet's inhabitants, and can come to an agreement that doesn't end in stains beneath their large scaly feet.

Earth has become the latest addition to the Draken Empire. The planet served merely as another expansion of the kingdom, meaning humans kept their sovereignty. Dragons indulged in Earth's various cultures and entertainment.

The biggest change was the job of becoming a servant. You were given a year of work to decide if you wanted to continue and you got to take up residence with the one you served. Who you served depended on a test, the more willing you look to serve, the higher rank you got. Higher rank meant more payment.

You had just graduated high school and decided to become a servant. Due to your history with bad grades, you thought college was a far reach. And truth be told after seeing the giant dragons looming over the city, you've come to admire them.

Your test was high and you were deemed worthy to serve a high ranking dragon. You got to choose from a list.

Corbus Draken
- The emperor of the Draken Empire. He was a European red dragon, almost always dresses in his red and gold armor. His long tail had a gold blade attachment and he only wore leg guards, keeping his large red soled feet bare. Corbus has immense pride and loved showing how big he is, loving when he looms over others at 200 feet and flexing his large muscles. He does show kindness to those he deems loyal.

Bael Zardis
- A yellow European dragon with a horn on the top of his snout. Head adviser to Corbus, he is usually dressed in fine robes which hide a bulky build. He usually appears calm, but takes glee in showing others their place beneath him.

Edard Draken
- The son of Corbus at nineteen years old. This buff red dragon dresses similar to that of earth's inhabitants. He has a lazy attitude and prefers to lay back and let servants worship him. Rather oblivious, he always thinks he loses servants only to find them squished into his sole or underwear.

Arthur Darbel
- A black scaled dragon knight with massive muscles, even bigger then Corbus. He always wears his silver armor and keeps a cold face. He truly wishes to just stamp out humans as he finds them annoying, but puts up with them for his king.

Who are you going to serve?

131.content:
The choice was a no brainer in your mind. You knew that you had gotten a high score on your servant aptitude test, but still you had to pinch yourself to make sure you weren’t dreaming when Corbus Draken’s name came up on the list. The eponymous dragon of the Draken Empire, who could pass up the opportunity to be in his presence, even if just by being his servant? Without any more thought on the matter, you ticked the box to the left of the emperor's name. You knew you made the right decision.

Within a week, you found yourself being transported to the Imperial Palace of the Draken Empire, and the official residence of Corbus and his family. To your surprise, you were not going to be moving off world for your new place in life; the Palace had been moved onto Earth. Apparently, the Dragons, and the Draken family especially, found humanity so interesting and engaging with all it’s flaws and curiosity, that they made Earth the new capital planet. It had to be placed somewhere far away from civilization on barren land however, due to the massiveness of a structure that houses 200 feet dragons with ease.

You had spent the better half of the last week inside a box, small enough for a dragon that it could fit in their palm and big enough for you that it doubled as a studio apartment. Despite the fact that the Draken Empire was a space faring civilization that was almost entirely comprised of fantastic creatures, it still had the infamous slog of bureaucracy. Your box had been shifted around from one place to the next, changing dragon hands whilst taking care not to disturb the delicate cargo inside.

Once you finally arrived at the Imperial Palace, you poked your head out of your little box window to see it in person. The great sight was comprised of six thick, square towers that dwarfed everything below them, connected by enormous, heavy walls made of brilliant white. Elaborate, stained glass windows were placed across the walls geometric patterns, along with holes and sniper’s nests for artillery

The dragon who was carrying your box, passed through the massive metal doors and entered the building proper. The whole interior was decorated with remnants of past victorious battles, from broken swords and shields to rusting energy rifles and shock grenades. After filling in a short security form, you were once gain exchanged to another dragon’s hands and carried to the great throne room. Magnificent braziers attached to one side of each of the six ivory columns light up every part of the throne hall and bathe the hall in a dancing glow of orange. The gems of the many artworks on the embowed ceiling dance in the flickering light while marble icons and statuettes look down upon the grey wood floor of the majestic hall.

The dragon walked his bare feet across the cobalt rug that ran from the throne. You held your breath, excitement and a twinge of nervousness coming up on you in an instant. You didn’t realize that you were feeling this anxious; of what is to come in your new duties or for you to start the, you did not know. Finally, the collapsible ceiling of your little box was opened, and you allowed yourself to be gently picked up in between the courier dragon’s two fingers. You were hoisted up into the air, and the first sight you saw...was him.

There, sitting atop his majestic throne of obsidian in front of a lavish gate of gilden wood, was Corbus Draken, his dazzling ruby red eyes piercing right into your soul. You failed to suppress a gasp as you took the sight of him in. He was...breathtaking. His muscular, defined body sank comfortably into the plush, cobalt pillows that adorned the throne. He only wore polished, gilden leg guards, leaving the rest of his body bare to your eyes. The great emperor gave an amused chuckle as he noticed your reaction, and brought forwards his open hands. Before you realized it, you had been placed inside his grip, and the courier was motioned away.

It was just you and him.

“Hello there, my little human.” Corbus greeted you in a thick, heavy voice that boomed in your ears and shook your body. “I assume you already know who I am?” He gave you a prideful grin, clearly knowing of your flustered emotions caused by his presence.

“Y-y-yes!” You stuttered out a response, finding it disturbingly difficult to force the words out of your throat. “Y-your Corbus Draken, the Emperor of the Draken Empire, and...and your amazing.”

Corbus’s smile grew even larger, his heart swelling further up with pride and adoration for his little servant. “Hmmm, I can’t seem to argue with you on that! And you...do you know who you are?”

“I’m...I am your servant.”

“My servant?” Corbus echoed, almost tasting the words coming off of his lips. “Is that all, my wittle human? Is that all you are, my personal slave?”

“Y...yes.” You respond after a couple seconds of hesitation. “That’s all I am, and it’s all i want to be!” You didn’t mean for you to say that last remark with such enthusiasm. It just came out...naturally.

Corbus let out a sigh of sheer contentment and brought you up to his draconian muzzle. You found yourself being nuzzled by the great emperor's red scales. They were hard as diamonds and soft as cotton at the same time, emanating a great warmth that made you at ease. You did your best to reciprocate the gesture, spreading your limbs out as far as they went and hugged as much as your new master’s flesh as possible.

“You certainly are the eager one, my little human” Corbus purred, delighting in his new servant’s antics. “I was going to give you a day to prepare before I asked you to do anything...but I don’t think that will be necessary.”

What does Corbus have you do first?

You were disoriented and had the wind knocked out of you, you rested on his clawed barefoot; as dragons never wore shoes because they liked the feeling of soil between their toes. As far as you know you’d just been threatened and attacked by a dragon, and needed to get out of here. You snapped out your dizzy state and caught your breath, you slid off his foot and began a dash into the grass. “Wait, why’re running? Jason, get back here! It ain’t safe!” your captor shouted as he threw his body to the grass trying to catch you, like a cat chasing his prey. You were scared shitless of how agile this muscle bound serpent was, you pushed your legs so far ahead that you felt like you were going to rip your leg muscles apart. “Shit, shit, shit! Not good, not good! Jason?!” your owner huffed as he desperately spanned his arms out and looked for you in the grass, his heart about to come out of his chest, terrified at the thought of you being squished or taken. Now in the cover of a field of green, you could see the backside of the dragon perched over and searching for you in the other side of the grass. You snuck as far away as you could. After a while, you couldn’t see him anymore. You found yourself back in the park, from a perspective that made you realize how big everything was. No doubt your captor would come looking for you, so you decided to take your chances finding a place to hide, hoping you wouldn’t end up on the bottom of an unsuspecting dragon’s foot. You headed for…

You barely manage a yelp as it descends. Just when you thought that was the end of you, the foot crashes down to the side and shadow seems to get deeper as the dragon leans over.

143131.content:
You're picked up in a massive claw slowly brought up to eye level. You stare, shaking in fear at the massive cobalt blue dragon. He had yellow eyes, gray scales on his belly. The clothing he wore didn't give you any ideas about his lifestyle either. Wearing a black unbuttoned cargo shirt, a pair of denim stonewashed blue jeans and a red sash around his waist, you also noticed his orange and gray headphones that were resting around his neck.

"You alright, buddy?" You notice it wasn't the dragon who spoke but rather a human who appeared to be in his mid twenties. The human was sitting on the dragon's snout and waves at you in a friendly manner. "Set him up here with me." The human said to the dragon.

To your surprise the dragon listened and placed you on his snout next to the pther human. "Sorry about that. Marc can be a little careless at times. I'm Laslow, and this big guy is Marc." Laslow introduced as Marc continued about his walk.

You introduced yourself and sat back enjoying the sunshine from the safe spot. Ludlow had told you that he and Marc were out for their daily stroll and thought the park would be the best place. You smiled and enjoyed conversing with Laslow as he was very friendly.

"So this Vulcan fellow? Did you want to get back to him?" Laslow asked as the two of you leaned back on Marc's snout.

"Well... I think he meant well... but he..." you flinch hearing Marc let out a low rumble.

Laslow chuckles. "Marc's just clearing his throat. He doesn't usually talk much."

Marc let out a low sigh as he squinted at the two of you. "Wanna stay with us?" He asked, his voice was rather shy sounding despite his impressive size.

Laslow chuckled. "Marc's not the one you gotta worry about in the household. Its his dad that's the worrying one."

"Only cuz dad wants me to inherit the family business." Marc states.

"Family business?" You ask slowly.

Marc let's out another sigh. "My dad sells," he paused thinking over his words. "a steroid for dragons. Helps them with physical activity. But he's not to keen on humans. Laslow here was actually a human that was living in the walls of the house until dad caught him and nearly ate him. Instead..."

"Instead Daddy Drake decided to let Marc keep me as a pet." Laslow cut in.

"I'll just tell dad that you're another pet I picked up. He'll leave it at that." Marc said as he sat on a park bench. "Or we can help you find Vulcan." He adds.
143131.title: Blue Dragon (early twenties)

1431312.content:
"I'd like to stay with you guys." You finally say after thinking it over.

"Welcome to the family, Jason." Laslow says as he ruffles your hair. "Hey Marc, how about we pick up some lunch?"

"What'd you have in mind Laslow?" Marc asks.

Laslow turns to you and smiles. "First day out on the city, what're you in the mood for, Jason?" He asks.

"Know of any good burger places around here?" You ask, finally feeling how hungry you were.

Marc thought for moment. "Yeah, I know a place." He says as he stands and walks a few blocks from the park. He stops at this small hole in the wall type place and goes inside. The moment you enter, you are greeted with dozens of smells of burgers, fries and other foods. Marc picks a booth near a window, facing the park. He sets you and Laslow down gently on the table then proceeds to look over a menu.

Laslow chuckles. "Unfortunately this place doesn't do human sized plates, so we'll just grab some from Marc's plate. Don't worry, we got a system down." He assures you as he takes a seat on the ceramic sugar holder.

It isn't long from when Marc orders that food is brought out. Marc turns to you and Laslow and smiles. "Dig in." He says.

Laslow wastes no time and rips some burger off and begins eating. You join him in doing such but constantly keeping one eye on Marc. "Marc usually waits til I'm done and sitting where he can see me before he starts eating." Laslow explained as he grabbed a chunk of fries and ate it. You nod and continue ripping handfuls of food and eating.

The chime of the diner bell is heard as another patron enters. You and Laslow paid it no mind as you ate. Marc's stomach finally growled a bit. And he reached for the burger. He took a bite then another and another. Unfortunately for you and Laslow, the two of you had gotten stuck to the delicious meal from the gooey cheese.

"Marc! Marc, we're still down here!" Laslow calls out.

14313122.content:
"Marc!" Both you and Laslos shout as the cobalt dragon tosses the last bit of burger into his jaws. The two of you are sealed in darkness with the only sounds being the wet slurping and munching sounds of the dragon chewing up the burger.

"Jason!" Laslow calls as he pulls you away from the razor sharp fangs. You grip onto Laslow tightly, fear dominating your mind. Laslow rolls and tumbles to the sides, pulling you with him as he dodges the mashed up burger bits. "Oh no..." he says as you both feel everything tip and begin to tumble down into the dragon's throat.

It's tight, it's humid and it's very hot. The entire time, you can't believe how calm Laslow is. After a while, you both enter the massive belly belonging to Marc. "You alright, Jason?" Laslow asks as he makes his way over to where you'd landed.

"We're in his stomach! He ate us! How can you be so calm?!" You were hysterical.

Laslow merely shrugged. "I'd be lying if I said this was the first time I ended up in Marc's stomach." He said calmly. He pulls you out of goopy mess of burger and fries and sits on one the folds in the stomach. "We'll be fine. It's hard to believe and strangd when you think about it. But I know we'll be fine. Truth is, I've been in here at least a dozen times. Yeah, its scary at times, but I always make it out alive." He says.

Somehow this reassures you and you just sit next to Laslow. "So what happens now?" You ask somewhat calmed down but still very scared of the current situation.

Laslow flashes you a gentle smile as he lays back. "We wait. Marc will figure out he accidentally ate us and get us out. Its just a matter of if we get out the front door or the back door." He explains before making himself comfortable. "My track record, its usually out the back."

"And you've never been digested by his stomach?" You ask now curious about how this crazy man has survived.

Laslow lazily yawns. "Marc once explained it as his stomach can somehow tell between living beings and food. Thus his stomach acids when produced don't affect living beings. So long as we avoid getting directly mixed in with lunch before the acids start, we'll be fine."

You were still very confused but trusted your new friend. After all, you were both in the dragon's stomach. He had no reason to lie to you. "And Marc?"

"He usually goes about his day. Or if he notices and is in a good mood, let's me out through the front door." Laslow replies as he closes his eyes. "Don't worry my friend, we'll be fine, as scary as this is. I've been inside Marc enough times to know how his body works, probably better than he does. Heck this one time, when he was hiding me from his dad, he dropped me down the front of his pants and I ended up getting accidentally swallowed by his dick." Laslow says with a laugh.

You couldn't help but laugh a little at your new friend's story. He continued with the details, noticing it calmed you down. "I'd be happy to introduce you to that side of him, if you'd like." Laslow joked.

"Dude, no! That's another guy's junk." You reasoned.

The two of you eventually fell asleep in Marc's stomach. The soft gurgles his stomach made and steady rhythmic beating of his heart, lulled both of you to snooze.

143131222.content:
Many hours later, you and Laslow had been pushed through the digestive system of his dragon buddy. Both of you awoke to the constant pushing and crushing sensation as you worked through Marc's rectum. Soon you both dropped out and landed with a splash in the massive toilet bowl.

Marc sighs briefly before his tail reaches down and picks both of you up. "Are you both alright?" He asks, concern in his voice as he sets you both on the counter.

Laslow laughs as he looks up at the blue dragon. "We're fine, Marc. Scares the ever living daylight out of our new friend. But we're fine."

Marc turns his attention to you. You give him a thumbs up. "I'm alright. Once Laslow calmed me down, it wasn't so bad." You said as Marc checked you over.

He sighs again then washes both of you up. "I'm real sorry about that. I should've been paying closer attention." The dragon says while he washes the two of you.

After yours and Laslow's bath, Marc takes both of you to his room. You're taken back at just how huge it is. He has all standard furniture you'd expect, plus a couple of bookshelves. He sets you and Laslow down on the nightstand and you notice the shoebox.

"Come on, I'll show you around my place." Laslow says as he signals for you to follow him. You follow him into the shoebox and see its set up to be its miniature house. Laslow smiles as you look around. "It may not be much, but its a nice place in the current world." He said as he sat down on his makeshift couch.

You look at Laslow. "Seems a little dusty. You don't spend much time in here do you?"

Laslow sighs. "I usually only come here when I need some alone time. But hey, my place is your place too now." You arch an eyebrow. "OK, you got me, I usually spend most my time with the big guy. And I'll admit, I usually sleep close by him." He pauses as he changes to sleepwear right in front of you. "Its getting late. You can sleep here, bed's on the other side of that wall." He paused to point. "Or you can sleep with the big guy. Don't worry, he doesn't move much once he falls asleep."

"I got some errands to run first before home Jason. If you feel like you need to breath or something is wrong, slap at my stomach, i'm sure ill feel ya down there." Vulcan began his walk , his pace slightly dragging you back and forth across his slick leathery belly, Each step causing a puff of intoxicating musk to blow up from under you. You weren't exactly sure what kind of relation you wanted with this dragon, but your future was starting to look up suddenly. You shuddered, and you think Vulcan felt you tense up at the sight as he began to walk a little faster to get past the restaurant quicker. That one sight made you forget most of what you had just seen over the past few minutes and it brought one cold truth to mind, your kind was prey, slaves, and pets to this all around superior species, and the only way out was death. You shook your head, no, you were gonna make the best of this, Vulcan was making out to be an indifferent owner who will let you do as you wish for the most part, and that was all you needed for now.

15.content:
Long ago, before the fall of the Roman Empire. There existed giant guardians who helped defend humanity against the unholy abominations called frights, that wished to wipe out the humans.

These guardians were Soul Dragons. A human was born with a connection to a dragon and was treated as a master. There existed multiple dragons across the world, most servicing rulers and generals.

The frights were soon sealed away and peace was stowed opun the earth. This didn't last long, as those with a Soul Dragon began using them for selfish reasons.

Lands were conquered, fields were burned, and resistance was crushed beneath a scaled sole.

Soon the dragons abandoned the humans refusing to be used for such selfish acts. Within centuries the dragons became a simple fable to teach children about the corruption of power.

However, in the 22nd century the frights would awaken from their seal and wreak havoc again. You were the only one could help since you were the last person to have a Soul Dragon.

Now then, who are you......

152.content:
It was the year 2078. In the present day the world has gone through many changes from what it once was. After the continental war in 2043, the borders of countries transformed and new regions formed. China and Mongolia have fused together under one republic, Manchuria has become an independent country, and new cities have been built in previous uninhabited areas.

However the forests not yet explored were home to one young man, who despite the harsh environment was able to survive with some BIG help
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Angúo was a seventeen year old living in the forest. At first it would seem a mystery on how he survived with his small and lean form. But one would know once they attack him and are covered in the shadow of a giant foot.

The boy was the last human who had the ability to summon a Soul Dragon. He was in fact the youngest, having summoned his dragon when he was only a baby. Angúo had been left in the forest as an infant, and gained his giant protector who took to raising him.

Fang was the name of his dragon. A blue dragon with white fur and whiskers, who wore a dark blue and black hanfu. He rose above the trees, with them only reaching his shin. The dragon had appeared when Angúo was a baby in a basket flooding in the river and despite being shocked at the age of his master, he still was able to gently scoop him into his palm. From that day Fang took to raising him.

Although normally the dragon acted calm and kind when with Angúo, he could be rather terrifying if the boy was ever threatened.

One time when playing with a rabbit, a hunter had demanded Angúo hand it over. Refusing, the hunter grabbed Angúo and began to drag him away, all while readying his gun. He stopped when a large THOOM shook the ground and knocked him down. He looked shocked as Fang stood over him with a angered look. After scooping up both Angúo and the rabbit, the dragon lifted his scaled sole over the hunter.

“P-please have mercy! I wasn’t goi-“

“SILENCE HUMAN! I can sense the dark aura around you. You were going to harm this child! The only thing you deserve is to decorate my sole!”

With that, Fang stomped down, shaking the forest and reducing the man to paste. As he walked away, he left footprints filled with red splatters.

Fang spent his days protecting Angúo, he dealt with intruders in different ways. If they were simple travelers he’d scare them off. But if they did intend to harm Angúo, they find themselves being crushed or eaten.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The sun rose over the forest, Fang opened his orange eyes gazing down at Angúo curled up in his palm. Smiling, the dragon stood up from his crossed leg sitting as he prepared to start his day.

info.description:
This story is focused on macro dragons. The basic plot of the story is that the main character is a human who depending on the scenario, experiences a dragon either pleastly or not so Pleasant.

The dragons in this story are anthromorphic. This is because they fit different stories rather then just being a dragon in a cave.

If you start a chapter remember to take what happened in the last into consideration.

Rules
- All micro/macro interactions are male only
- You can do what you want but no scat or piss.
- Don't post short chapters, try at least to post a paragraph.
- If you add a choice please try to add to it.
- In all scenarios the human is at least 1 inch tall compared to the dragon.
